passage:
(1) Weather is what happens in the sky every day. It can be sunny, rainy, windy, or cloudy. Climate is the usual weather in a place over many years. Some places have hot climates, while others have cold climates. Weather can change quickly, but climate changes slowly over time.

(2) Rain is an important part of weather. Rain happens when water drops fall from clouds. But how does water get into clouds? Water from oceans, lakes, and rivers turns into vapor when it gets warm. This process is called evaporation. The water vapor goes up into the sky and forms clouds.

(3) When the air gets cold, the water vapor in clouds turns back into water drops. This process is called condensation. If the drops get big enough, they become too heavy to stay in the air. Then they fall to the ground as rain. If the air is very cold, the drops freeze and fall as snow or hail.

(4) Rain is important for all living things. Plants need rain to grow. Animals need plants for food, and they also need water to drink. People also need water for drinking, cooking, and washing. Without rain, life on Earth would not be possible. That is why understanding how rain forms is important for everyone.

According to the passage, what is the difference between weather and climate?

options.A: Weather is always sunny, while climate can be rainy.
options.B: Weather is what happens daily, while climate is the usual weather over many years.
options.C: Weather changes slowly, while climate changes quickly.
options.D: Weather is about temperature, while climate is about rain.

questions.question: Based on the passage, what is evaporation?

options.A: When water drops fall from clouds
options.B: When water vapor turns into water drops
options.C: When water turns into vapor due to heat
options.D: When drops freeze and fall as snow

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what is condensation?

options.A: When water drops get too heavy
options.B: When water vapor turns back into water drops
options.C: When water drops fall as rain
options.D: When water drops freeze into snow

questions.question: When does rain fall to the ground, according to the passage?

options.B: When the air is very cold
options.C: When water drops become too heavy
options.D: When clouds form in the sky

questions.question: What happens when the air is very cold, according to paragraph 3?

options.D: Water drops freeze and fall as snow or hail

questions.question: Based on the passage, why is rain important?

options.B: It makes the weather change quickly
options.C: It is necessary for all living things

questions.question: According to the passage, which of the following needs rain to grow?
What is the main purpose of paragraph 4?

options.C: To explain why rain is important

questions.question: Where does water vapor come from, according to the passage?
What would happen without rain, according to the passage?

options.D: Life on Earth would not be possible
